timeline.bodyText: Elide core should not depend directly on Hibernate.  Only the data stores that use hibernate should have this dependency.
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020, Yahoo Inc.
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0
+ * See LICENSE file in project root for terms.
+ */
+
+import org.hibernate.Session;

timeline.bodyText: Instead of creating an abstract class - create a functional interface (with no dependencies on things like hibernate).
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@
+/*
+ * Copyright 2020, Yahoo Inc.
+ * Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0
+ * See LICENSE file in project root for terms.
+ */
+
+import org.hibernate.Session;
+
+/**
+ * Cancel Session implementation.
+ */
+
+public abstract class CancelSession {

replies.bodyText: I think the functionalInterface will require an entityManager as an argument - and as such - it should probably live in the Aggregation Store and JpaStore respectively.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: YOu can make this a local variable and use it multiple places.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: Another issue - you are unwrapping the factory - not the entity manager.  I don't think that is correct.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Don't create an entityManager here.  Let the transaction create the entity manager.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Let's not add an EntityManagerSupplier to the constructor.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Remove
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Can we shorten the name of this interface (we already know this is for the AggregationDataStore since it is an inner class).
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Remove the entity manager from the constructor.  The AggregationStore (other than the SQLQueryEngine) should not have a direct dependency on the EntityManager
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Instead of implementing cancel here, why not move this to the super class?
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Why not implement cancel here so we don't have to redefine it in each subclass.
timeline.author: aklish
aklish

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't look right - why are we defining the cancel method twice here and passing it through two separate functions?
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Remove entityManagerFactory as an argument.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: We define the transaction cancel method four times.  Let's define this once with a static, final variable and just use that everywhere.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Just return a Future here instead of the Implementation.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: You could make this an inner class of the SQLQueryEngine - not abstract - and it can just call the TransactionCancel member.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: So this line creates a new session and then immediately cancels it.  We want to close the existing session - not a new one.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: There are several places where spacing is off.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
An inner class can reference the members of the outer class if it is not static.  There is no need to:

Define private members
Have a constructor with arguments.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Let's find a better name than FutureImplementation.  How about QueryResultFuture?
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Add @Override.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: I don't see the implementation of executeQuery that returns a Future here.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: You are missing a lot of the other Future functions.  There is more than just cancel.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Can you mention in the comments that the implementation must be thread-safe?
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -267,4 +267,9 @@ default boolean supportsPagination(Class<?> entityClass, FilterExpression expres
      * @return UUID id
      */
     UUID getRequestId();
+
+    /**
+     * cancel running transaction

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to call run() here.  Calling queryResult.get() should invoke queryResult.run()
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Don't set null here.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: cache is much more readable than cx.  Can you revert back to the more readable variable names?
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText: Same for mDStore, qEngine, emFactory, etc.
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: This inner class is missing javadoc.  The linter will complain.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: This code is violating DRY (do not repeat yourself).  Make a function in this class to avoid repeating the same block over and over.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Remove all references to queryResult.run() in this PR.
timeline.author: aklish

replies.bodyText:
The delta between the original line and your modifications can be just 4 characters:
List<Object> results = StreamSupport.stream(engine.executeQuery(query).get().getData().spliterator(), false)
replies.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
For UnitTests, you can simply have the test throw Exception and avoid all these try catch blocks.
Look at my prior comments - all of this can be changed by just adding 4 characters - without these large blocks of duplicate code.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: You shouldn't need to pass transactionCancel as an argument to the supplier.  When the supplier is created, it can have a reference to transactionSupplier through closure.  Remove this extra argument.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText:
So for example, there is no need to include txCancel as a parameter to the supplier.  Rewrite like:
(entityManager) -> { return new NonJtaTransaction(entityManager, jpaTransactionCancel); }
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Because the signatures are the same, you may be able to define this once as a Function rather than the concrete types above - and just use the single reference below.
timeline.author: aklish
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -56,6 +58,10 @@
      * @return An instance of ElideDynamicEntityCompiler.
      * @throws Exception Exception thrown.
      */
+
+     private final AbstractJpaTransaction.JpaTransactionCancel jTC = (e) -> { e.unwrap(Session.class).cancelQuery(); };

timeline.bodyText: Remove txCancel from the supplier.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: See if these can be consolidated into a single variable using one of Java's built in Function classes.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Remove this comment.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Unify the variable names txCancel and jpaTransactionCancel.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: txCancel was a better name than func.  I would change everywhere.
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Rename to TXCANCEL
timeline.author: aklish

timeline.bodyText: Let's add javadoc for cancel (close isn't needed because it is an Override).
timeline.author: aklish
